snippet: Johns Hopkins earned an A minus on global health research, an advocacy group found. But there were a lot of D’s, and even two F’s.
abstract: Student-led advocacy group Universities Allied for Essential Medicine issues its second ranking of American universities that receive large grants for biomedical research; rankings are based on percentage of research that focuses on diseases of poor and whether study results are affordable and accessible to scientists in poor countries.
lead_paragraph: Johns Hopkins earned an A minus on global health research, an advocacy group found. But there were a lot of D’s, and even two F’s.

headline.print_headline: University Grades Are Mixed on Research for the Poor
headline.main: University Grades Are Mixed on Research for the Poor
